I built another Raudive Diode Device ( #3) this eve=
ning. This one can be used in two configurations.
1) With the plug connecte=
d directly into the diode device and then into the recording device.
2) The=
 plug connected to a cable and that cable connected to the diode device. Th=

<BLOCKQUOTE style="PADDING-LEFT: 5px; MARGIN-LEFT: 5px; BORDER-LEFT: rgb(16,16,255) 2px solid">From: M.A. Coletta (Mike) <michaelcoletta@...><BR>Subject: [EVP-ITC] Raudive Diode Device #3<BR>To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com<BR>Date: Monday, November 24, 2008, 7:51 PM<BR><BR>
<DIV id=yiv1357420892>
<DIV id=ygrp-text>
<DIV>
<DIV>Greetings fellow researchers,</DIV>
<DIV>I built another Raudive Diode Device ( #3) this evening. This one can be used in two configurations.</DIV>
<DIV>1) With the plug connected directly into the diode device and then into the recording device.</DIV>
<DIV>2) The plug connected to a cable and that cable connected to the diode device. The cable provides some isolation between the diode device and the recording device.</DIV>
<DIV>I haven't tested it yet... that will be done tomorrow or the next day.</DIV>
<DIV>You can see pictures and a schematic, here:<BR><A href="http://ufomagazine.blogspot.com/2008/11/raudive-diode-device-3.html" target=_blank rel=nofollow>http://ufomagazine. blogspot. com/2008/ 11/raudive- diode-device- 3.html</A></DIV>
<DIV>- Mike C. (UFO Geek)</DIV></DIV></DIV></BLOCKQUOTE></td></tr></table><br>
